intro: Hypochaeris philippii, commonly known as the Philippi's hairy yellowrocket, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed areas and thrives in full sun. It produces yellow flowers with a distinctive hairy appearance, and its leaves are usually alternate and serrated. Hypochaeris philippii is often found in grasslands and along roadsides, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
